intro: Distomocarpus maroccanus, commonly known as the Moroccan distomocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery leaves adapted to withstand dry conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
